description.narrative: The objective of the Performance, Results and Accountability Project for Tanzania is to enhance capacity, performance and accountability of Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs) in the use of public resources and service delivery to levels consistent with timely and effective implementation of the strategic and priority programs under the National Strategy for Growth and Reduction of Poverty (MKUKUTA). The restructuring will support: (i) changing the project development objective to align it with the scope of activities in the underlying restructured Second Public Service Reform Program (PSRP-II), (ii) exercising greater selectivity and limiting activities to only those which can be completed by December 31, 2012, (iii) reducing the number of components from seven to four, (iv) reducing the scope of the project from all MDAs to only ten ministries and four associated agencies2 with some exceptions, (v) cancellation of SDR 6.5 million (US$10 million equivalent), (vi) changing the project implementation modality from implementation by the President's Office Public Service Management (POPSM) and other ministries, departments and agencies (MDAs) to implementation only by the POPSM, and (vii) terminating the Adaptable Program Loan (APL) arrangements as no longer applicable in view of the significant changes in the scope of the program.

condition.narrative: Submission of annual work plans and budgets

title.narrative: Public perception of public servants with integrity

comment.narrative: TI Index
TI Index (higher score is better)
The HR tools are Training Needs Assessment; Training Plan; Succession Plan; HR Plan
The target has been over achieved.
The level of dissatisfaction was assessed at 25% and the residual (75%) was assumed as those satisfied. This includes those whoareneither satisfied nor dissatisfied.
Since the assessment is done for the PSRP on an annual basis the target relates to June 30, 2013.
Measures the level of satisfaction (73%) plus those either satisfied nor dissatisfied (7%)

title.narrative: Zanzibar retrieval time for subject records in selected MDAs

comment.narrative: The program in Zanzibar was included in the project only after restructuring of the PRAP in April 2012.
The target has been achieved.

The six processes are: (1) Issue of passports (2) Inter school transfer of secondary students (3) Processing and Maintenance ofstudent loans (4) Mineral licensing (5) Water supply billing (6) Transport licensing
The target was already achieved by the end pf 2011-12.

The five processes improved under Phase II are: (1) BRELA-Business Name Search (2) POPSM and MOF-HR update and payroll process (3)POPSM-Complaints handling Process (4) POPSM registry computerized as part of e-office (5) TFDA-Premise registration and licensingoffood and drugs

title.narrative: Citizens requests for information which were met by the government

comment.narrative: The target has been achieved. Tanzania is a member of the Steering Committee of the Open Government Partnership and has alreadyformulated its plan to implement open government.

title.narrative: Public service pay compared to labour market comparators

comment.narrative: Whilst the target has been over achieved there continues to be an ad hoc approach to public service pay indexation andnegotiationswith specific Unions with spill over impacts for negotiations with other Unions.
The survey report was submitted in December 2012.

title.narrative: Average time taken to retrieve subject records
Capacity of national repository enhanced to hold archieved records

comment.narrative: Construction of the NRC has been completed and the building will be handed over by the Contractor to the Government on December15,2012. Equipment to make it operational has been procured and staff appointed to make the NRC operational.
The NRC has been built at Dodoma. Furniture and equipment to make it operational is being procured.

title.narrative: Women with post graduate training who have assumed "decison making posts"

comment.narrative: This sub program has been highly appreciated for the empowerment it ensures for women in government who, due to early marriage oreconomic pressures, were unable to pursue academics early in life and are debarred from promotions since they lack a Masters Degree.
Overachieved

title.narrative: MDAs reporting on their performance per established standards

comment.narrative: The target has been achieved.

title.narrative: PSRP-II workplan implemented within target time frame

comment.narrative: All the targeted activities have been substantively completed.

title.narrative: Level of accuracy of Public Service profile generated across all MDAs by HCMIS version 9

comment.narrative: The target has been achieved. The accuracy is 100% for additions after the new HCMIS was launched in January 2012.

title.narrative: Poicies developed which are participatory and evidence based

comment.narrative: The Policy Development target has been met. Since the PSRP program is continuing 2 additional policies (Trade and Transport) havebeen taken up in the current year
A policy for Ministry of Agriculture and a second policy for Ministry of Lands has been developed using the guidelines but is yetto be approved by Cabinet.

title.narrative: e-services available on the Government of Tanzania portal

comment.narrative: The target was achieved by the end of 2011-12 and dissemination of the availability of the portal is continuing under the ongoingPSRP. The number of hits and real time availability data will be available at the end of 2012-13.
The services are: (1) Government directory (2) Business name search (3) Lands title search
The target was over achieved by the end of 2011-12.

title.narrative: Share of women in officials trained for leadership
Cases of violation of the code of conduct resolved/ finalised
MDAs where HCMIS version 9 is operational

comment.narrative: The Tanzania Integrated HCMIS/Payroll was selected by PRMPS as one of the PFM/PSR success stories to be presented at the PRMPStownhall in December 2012.
Overachieved.

title.narrative: Satisfactory quality of implementation in 14 MDAs of 5 performance management tools

comment.narrative: The target was already over achieved in the specified 14 MDAs by June 30, 2012 but performance has further improved by December2012.

title.narrative: Complaints resolved out of complaints received

comment.narrative: The target was already over achieved by the end of 2011-12. The new systems for monitoring compliance are having an impact andimprovements continue.
Over achieved.

title.narrative: MDAs where improved complaints handling system is operational

comment.narrative: The target has been over achieved.
Over achieved. In addition to the 15 ministries it is also operational in 63 other Departments and Agencies
The target has been achieved.
